Watching this movie was like watching wonder years ....Find your love, Live your life. :) I love the idea that the scriptwriter has managed to make a story that is completely different from others. Sure we have watched many narrated movies, but narrated by 2 different people with different perspectives? Watching this movie was like watching wonder years ....Find your love, Live your life. :) I love the idea that the scriptwriter has managed to make a story that is completely different from others. Sure we have watched many narrated movies, but narrated by 2 different people with different perspectives? Watching this movie was like watching wonder years ....Find your love, Live your life. :)

Read "heartache" twice, is really is heartache. A pair of children, a tree, a very simple story, tell a stirring story. What I me most is that a girl has a sense of introspection in her teens, examining whether the person they love is worth loving. Once she touched her self-esteem, she immediately decided to give up the boy. The "love" in our culture, seems to be low to the dust, abandon self-esteem is called love, make cheap when true love.

Flipped is a very sweet, innocent film.It takes you down to the memory lane of the first so called love you had in your childhood.The performances of actors will not disappoint you especially the two young protagonists did a really great job expressing every emotion purely.The story has a quite slow pace but it is not at all boring. You will enjoy every scene.I really loved how they portrayed the feelings, which take a turn as the name suggests.The story is simple but yes it is touching as many people can relate to it.If you want something light and good to watch it is the one to go for.

If you're tired of watching thriller, horrors, complex storylines, or need a break from the frustrating exhausting life, this is it for you. All the emotions portrayed is overwhelming so much... It's just great, greater than most romantic coming of age movies I've watched.

Is there anything beautiful than a trenage love story? Unless it makes sense to the adult as well. Flipped was such a fresh story with flawless script which portrayed not only love but also life. It was also an honest movie, as it showed outer beauty always surpasses the inner beauty. It also portrayed the complexities teenagers have to go through in their adolescence. To sum up, it was a spectacular movie.

A movie pure at heart. Adorable and sweet. Really gives feel good vibes and spreads a soothing effect. An emotional plot revolving around two innocent people.
Must watch!

My favorite part is the basket boy auction. The boy's appearance level highlights the moment and he shows the nervous, the girl's inner entanglement and kindness. Finally two people with want to eat with each other's heart
Love, but each other sitting opposite each other irrelevant people.Bryce suddenly got up and walked over to her, Julie in her dream
The moment the kiss came, it pushed Bryce away. Maybe it was the crowds, maybe it was not sure if I still liked Bryce. So she ran away.Bryce's courage and perseverance after confirming her heart also broke her cowardice. Finally, he replanted a tree that was important to Julie, and the two hugged each other in their hearts.It turns out that a love story without kissing can also be so sweet and greasy, and beautiful things can actually not rely on visual impact.

To be completely honest with all of you, I haven't taken a liking to many of the recent movies, considering they're either about giant robots, aliens, or a terrible prequel to a classic. This movie came out just last year, and it's now one of my favourite movies. For a movie to get into my 'Favourite movies list' it has to have great acting, a believable storyline, characters that make you feel a connection with them and most importantly, the ability to make me think. To have this movie make it onto that list alongside titles like The Shawshank Redemption, The Boy In The Striped Pyjamas and Little Miss Sunshine, well then, this movie is amazing.The two leads are about 15 and 16 this year, which is roughly my age. I'm going to tell you the truth, I really do not like the new face of Hollywood. The acting is blunt and the actors aren't being the characters. However, McAuliffe and Carroll have brought their respective characters' personalities out. They've put it out for all to see and sympathise with, taking the audience on a beautiful journey in their lives. I loved the two characters from the very beginning, and was intrigued by how practical and down to earth they were. What I loved was how the storyline unfolded. Both sides of this childhood romance was shown, both parties able to tell their side of the story. Typically, a romance is told in such a way that there's always one victim in the situation, and s/he cries until the other welcomes them back with open arms. Well boo hoo. In Flipped, both Bryce and Juli's sides were told from the first person point of view, which allows the readers to feel for the two characters as though they were part of the romance. The technique used was such a personal one, one which connected the audience with the movie. The audience was allowed a trek inside both their minds, all the while just thinking 'Oh, just get together already!' It made me want to reach into the screen and yell 'Now, elope.'Flipped will forever be on my 'Watch Forever list'. A timeless, innocent romance of two young loves which will be enjoyed by all. A definite 9/10.

Before l watch this movie,l have heard a lot about it. There are a lot of people who have seen this movie said it's very nice,but l never believe. Until l watched it myself,l was deeply moved by this story. The altitude between July and Bryce lead the whole story,and what made me moved was the sincere love between two children that has no profits. This type of love is what l wanted. Beside that,the characters' skill of acting in this movie are also perfect. And in the ending,there is more room for imagination for moviegoers,like whether the first kiss between July and Bryce will happen or not.

Rarely, are we treated to a narration for not one, but both sides. In this movie, we watch a love story unfold between Juli and Bryce and they simultaneously narrate to us Thier side of the story.Exquisite. Splendid.Class!
Such a beautiful movie. Loved it. Clean and sweet.

We watched this because we live in Ann Arbor and we were hoping to see some familiar landmarks. We didn't even see that! Bryce is cute but this movie has no other redeeming features.Stilted dialogue and stiff performances by all except grandpa. No emotional connection. However, we did love seeing a snake eat a whole egg, crack it in his belly and spit out the shell. Not gross at all but not at all convincing that this snake was actually a pet at home.We like the chickens and the ending because a tree was planted and it was a real sycamore tree. I hope they left it there after the movie.Not worth the $3.99 we spent to rent it.

Cried, laughed, and was connected to this true romance flick. Highly recommend this movie. As one who found my "jewels" at 16, the themes, dialogue, and mature conversations leave the sad pessimistic modern tropes in the dust. This is a true love and romance comedy for the entire family. Fully engaged and fully in love.

I saw this movie without knowing anything about it but a short premise. At first I thought it was going to be one of those typical teen flicks where the girl changes her appearance and the boy finally likes her. I was so wrong.
The story is simply beautiful. It deals with difficult themes and does so very well. Although it starts off cheesy, soon it is clear that it is anything but. The actors are amazing, the characters are interesting and strong, cinematography is very impressive.
Powerful and still sweet. I liked it.

You know a movies is good when you don't want the movie to end an I felt that while watching the movie. It's like I want to be in the movie little longer. Picturesque country side, those kids, love .Oh I miss them so much. I would say the best Teen romance movie I ever watched.

Every time a innocent love teaches so many things, what we can't anticipate. Each time its different and genuine. Flipped is another story which will make many of your memories revisit. Well acted and directed movie grasp story from very beginning and goes through lot of twists or flips we may say. Apart from love story, director did good job to capture high spirited character of Juli. Her energy on screen is infectious. As one song goes Sun's not too high, love gonna take you down, a stubborn boy learns his way to find where his heart belongs.Overall a beautiful tale from one the fine director with good support from rest of cast.

I love this movie because it's different from the other same genres. It explains the little girl fall in love for the little boy at first sight and to express her love throughout adolescence. What makes me the most impressive is the dreamy scene, the total picture makes me feel very happy and relaxed. The story proceeds in chronological order, with a compact plot that does not drag, and the cohesion is very appropriate. The director uses a dual protagonist perspective to shoot, which can help the audience better understand the theme. The only drawback is that the ending of the story was a bit sudden and ended unexpectedly.

It's a story about growing up,family,self knowledge and the perception of others. All action begins with love,Juli fell in love with Bryce at first sight, so she has a long infatuation and preference for him;Juli's father loves his family and life, so he would rather be down and out than give up his brother, so he loves to describe life with paintings;Juli's two brothers love music, so they pursue their dreams fearlessly. Bryce's father also loves music, so he hates himself for giving up music. This is one of the most important themes:love
Meanwhile,I have seen a lot of different attitudes towards life and the choices people make as they grow up. What impressed me most was Julie's father's statement about whether the whole is greater than the sum of its parts and Bryce's final growth.Julie's father's words let us realize that the cognition of people should not be attracted by the surface of the bright, the inner fullness is the most important.The growth of Bryce is what touched me most. After a series of events, Bryce learned to think by himself and express his ideas bravely, instead of being led by people around him. This is the growth and transformation of a teenager, which deeply touched me.

This film is live a fresh air which makes you breath lot better than any other coming of age and romantic films. The well cast actress makes the plot look just as natural as it should be. The shy kid, Bryce is just like every other shy kid of the world, thing and very polite.. the aggressive july who is free and has lots of guts and she lives in her own world where everything should be done her way.. It's like living a childhood memory once again...
Thanks for making this film. It's treat to watch and will be in my desk forever.
I gave this movie a 7 only because there are something's that leave me with questions.

I watched the film with less expectation but I was immediately hooked. The plot was well organized and the characters are strung together neatly. The main characters Bryce and Juli are really cute. I was left wondering my days back in elementary school, the teenage love, mood swings, unpredictable behavior and the never ending saga of changes. Although there are some parts that I suppose can add more substance like the character of professor Simon. After watching the movie I was left quietly sitting in our living room area and just stare blankly and I was smiling (sounds crazy but it's true). These are low budget movies with every bit of penny worth it. I give it 10 out of 10 stars as I was deeply happy on the outcome of the film.

I have watched this novel many times by myself, and I like the film itself. The director basically restored most of the details in the original work, and the monologue is basically the same. Everyone longs for a simple, carefree and happy love, but in the end reality always defeats us, but we still ca n't lose the ability of the original love, this film can take you back to the past and teach you love courage.

A moving film, a tree, two children, a simple story that can't be simple, describes too much soul stirring. It's always easy to think of that simple and exciting childhood.

This is one of my favorite movies! I don't recall when I first saw it but I was a probably still a teen, I'm close to 30 now and I still watch it everytime. It's the most sweet and real story I've seen and it's perfect that is set on the 60's it just turns sweeter. The grandpa is very wise. The two main actors are great. And I just wanted to hit Garrett in the face. 😅
Is just flawless. That ending is perfect and it makes me absolutely certain that they grew old together. I wish they would make a movie showing the rest of their lives, I bet it would be a beautiful story. Hope one day I'll show Flipped to my kid and that he'll love watching it as much as I do.

The story of two teenagers who met unexpectedly, when Bryce's family moved in the opposite house to Julie. She fell in love with him instantly. There was no doubt about it that she fell for his beautiful dazzling eyes. But for Bryce she was just a staler. It took 4 years for Bryce to actually understand and accept his love for her. She waited and waited, went through everything alone.. But for Bryce she was someone he wanted to get away from. But realization dawned on him when he hurt her pretty badly. And after getting hurt repeatedly she became distant, maybe got over him. But, he fell oh so deeply in love with her. At last they got together when Bryce planted the sycamore tree for her, one that got cut down, one she loved so fondly. Love comes to us in completely unexpected ways. Not every time we are ready to give in. But true love waits. It flips your heart and you fall oh so deeply in it unknowingly.
This story will take you on a roller coaster of emotions. It'll make you soft to the core. And will make you believe that in any corner of the world there's still the purest form of love.

I was just surprised by this movie. It will engross you, make you feel excited, and leave you smiling and wanting more. The direction is beautiful. It brings a new style of narration, where the same story is told both by the male and the female leads, leaving us a contrast that is sure to be enjoyed.As for acting, the cast couldn't be more perfect. The child actors strive to impress. Me, being a John Mahoney fan, loved the movie all the more. Every scene, he's in, he'll help you stick a smile through out. Overall, its a must watch. My words! :)

A Beautiful, well written, impeccably acted and wonderfully directed movie. What makes it more charming is that it is based in the 1950s and the early 1960s, which adds a hint of class and drama to all the characters. There is a separate genre of coming of age movies, as how one finds him/herself under the various circumstances. But Flipped gives you more sense of things in not so obvious sense. It touches so many aspects of life and connects with you at so many level. The Story uses the teenagers as tools to give you an enlightenment on perspective, prejudice, character, Morality, Love and Life. The movie stays with you and will leave a smile every time you will hear the word "Flipped".

*May Contain Spoilers* *May Contain Spoilers* *May Contain Spoilers**May Contain Spoilers**May Contain Spoilers**May Contain Spoilers* To start off, I would like to state that I am not a professional critic. I am just an ordinary person who LOVES classic romantic/ romantic comedy movies. Anyways, I rate this movie 7 out of 10 stars. As a lover of movies, I basically seen MOST romantic movies. This movie was some-what predictable, however, this movie provides an awesome warm spectacular feeling when you watch it. This movie consists of very good actors and screenplay. This movie was also unique on how it was presented. In the movie it shows the two perspectives of the two lovers and their interpretation of the same event. The event of both of them falling in love. I recommended this movie to the ages of 16 and older. However this movie can easily be recommended those younger. This movie can totally relate to you if you ever had your "first" love. :D
I loved this movie so much! It documented each viewpoint in both boy and girl and their rollercoaster of emotions. This is a must see!

"Flipped" is an awesome movie. It is one of the best movies i have ever seen. The story is narrated in such a way that you can feel both side of the relationship. You can easily relate to the two characters Juli and Bryce. I liked the switching of points of views between Bryce and Juli. This gave the movie an extra niche. The kids and their parents both played their role excellently well. Each character played its own part in building the character of the two kids. The role played by John Mahoney was important and critical for the story too. This movie can be very touching . I would really recommend this movie as it has a great story and with astonishing narration. You will love the time spent watching this movie.

The premise had such promise, and the structure (alternating perspectives) was a great way to tell the story. I have to blame it on the director. There's no way this many halfway decent (or better) actors could turn in such superficial performances. The family yelling scenes are pathetically bad, no nuance at all, suited for film-making 30+ years ago. Everything the Anthony Edwards character does is cringe-worthy and over the top. Look at the gestures the characters make. It's like nothing was suggested to tone down the melodrama. Only Madeline Carroll shows exceptional acting ability, and even that is not consistent. Also, listen to the diction in the dialog. This was supposed to take place in the early 60s, but the words and phrases used are colloquial from today. It ends up being a cross between an After School Special and something on Lifetime. It's not unwatchable, but only as a last resort.

It is a classic movie, telling a complete story from two different perspectives. The two protagonists of the story have their own characteristics. The heroine falls in love at first sight to pursue crazily, and the hero gradually changes from aversion at the beginning.

Now I too, want to flip myself. One of those beautiful movies which could melt your heart. This movie defines romance. This is what romance genre supposed to be. I don't know what's wrong with rating, not as famous as it is supposed to be but this movie must be watched by everyone who are willing to watch these sort of movies(teenage crush). After watching this became my favorite. All the cast acted very well. It becomes more attractive when the movie shows point of views by both girls and boys. Although,I haven't read the book neither do I want to I afraid I might disappointed. I look forward to watch more of these kind of beautiful movies.

I always wondered what girls think about all our actions???? but seeing "Flipped" I found my answers to them,its a nice little journey deep into our feelings with a lot of environmental awareness and cleanliness that is must needed for usThe screenplay is too professional and never did i feel that its the same over and over,but i just went into the scenes again and again,it taught me how to respect others feelings and to stay cool and calm about everythingMost importantly it thought me how to see life in a different way,in a way that i can enjoy each and every moment of it and frame it to get that back again and againFlipped is a must watch journey into our hearts!!!!

I forgot how I ended up finding this movie, I had assumed it was like any other romantic movie, Flipped however is so much sweeter and with more individual and original characters, each with their own unique personality and individual quirks. The way the film is structured and narrated from each protagonist makes it even more heartwarming. It is unexpectedly different, original even, in comparison to the regurgitated romantic comedy movies that have no depth. It is a movie for all ages as Flipped explores each family member and I assure you, you can definitely relate to one of them in someway and feel comfortable and warm watching this movie. I fell in love with the cast, each actor fitted in their roles perfectly.It has its funny moments, cute, heart-throbbing and sad moments; it's Truly Wonderful, Original and sweet. A Great family movie. With an original storyline and a lovely portrayal of one family's bonds.

First of all, I love this movie so much and I would like to appreciate Rob because he reminds me of my first love via this movie. The movie is processing with two main characters – Juli and Bryce. Juli is a very beautiful girl: Long chestnut hair, big green eyes, like a melted ice cream in the summer. However, she is pretty naughty. She is ready for a relationship when she is 7 and she even hit the newspaper's headline because of hampering her neighbors cutting the tree. She is entangled his new neighbor which is a little handsome boy Bryce. Bryce doesn't like to stay with Juli and so does his father Steven. Steven thinks Juli seems to be too animated and he hates Juli's father too! Steven thinks Richard is a jerk because of his ugly painting and ugly courtyard. In short, Juli's family is a freak in the neighborhood. With the age growing up. Juli and Bryce's life are slowly and subtly changing. Their views of the each other and also the world are changing too. In this process, Bryce's grandfather Chet plays an important character. He is the first guy to helps Bryce finds Juli's unique and helps Juli in obscurity. Moreover, the most interesting thing of the story is that the director uses the linear narrative mode, it also has a sub-mode of repetition and contrast. In this way, I can clearly feel the difference, contradictions, gaps between the boys and girls. It just sent me back to when I was young and reminding how much I avoided girls and how many tricks that I put on them.My favorite part of the film is the experiences of the main character's growth. Most of the coming of age genre movies are event driven not personality driven, the psychological changes and behavioral choices are often driven by some sudden events. However, Flipped describes the processing of the growing and maturing in the daily life. Juli doesn't love thinking since she was young. She realizes the beauty's difference of the appearance and the inherent when she pursuits the true beauty. Bryce also becomes a warrior from a cowardly kid step by step. Rob leads us to flip from Juli's view to Bryce's view to shows us the true nature of their friendship and love, their love and respect to each other and ends this story with a lovely and sweet ending. All in all, I enjoyed this movie and would like to recommend it!

Well what I can say ! Lovely Storyline was perfect and unique.Each dialog was what u think it should be because u would have said the same.while watching the movie i was totally in it.And Callan Macauliffe made no mistakes.I am telling u this boy has a promising great future.Great timely gestures,indicating exactly what was being said. Juli bakers and Bryce Loski ,after seeing this movie , I cant convince myself that they are not real world characters.They seem so real.the plot was excellent. I hope if their would have been Flipped 2 but to those who haven't yet seen this movie ,I strongly recommend it.Realtime love and romance and pure one indeed.!!!

Though it might sound another sensitive and light entertainment at first, it had been a joyful experience from beginning to end to me. Then again, I love and admire almost all of Rob Reiner's work. He achieves to imprint a soul to the story and their characters in his movies (rare to find in an American reel), blurring the gap I feel there is in the way of telling a story (regarding European approaches e.g.), and gets the best of both worlds with a true original. If I ever get into this business as I've been dreaming since my kid years', I would love to follow his example.My deepest thanks to his work, and very best wishes he keeps on making these worth watching films.

I saw the film, with my family, in French. I know, it's a good little film, but, sadly, it was French-Canadian
(a mistake on my part, I hadn't paid attention on the DVD cover, and for a European family, the language and the accent of the French-Canadien dubbers is simply horrible, the translation of the original dialogue is too weird for us, scriptwriters write the texts in Canadian-French almost word for word. For exemple : "for real" in English become "pour vrai" in French-Canadian, but in French from France or Belgium, "for real" is translated by : "pour de vrai ou vraiment !". So, because of that, the film was, for us, not as so beautiful as it had to have been. It's a cute film, but I will have to see it a second time in the original language to make a real and good review.
And for my friends from French Canada counties, no worries, I love you, I love your accent, I love your expressions so naïve... Then "Tabernacle", try to do good translation from English (not a word to word) and you will be great in all over the world for the French people :)
Also, sorry for my English, I'm not as good as I will have to be. :)

I really enjoyed this movie. As a matter of fact, it is the first movie I immediately watched again (DVD) since the 1970s (theater). As noted elsewhere, this is a refreshing departure from the standard special effects vehicles. It captures the mood and pace of the 1960s nicely. The alternate perspectives of the two main characters worked well, and the development of the characters is adroitly done. I actually did not recognize Penelope Ann Miller and Rebecca DeMornay until the end credits. This may be because I had not seen either actor in a movie for some years, but also probably equally due to their makeup and clothing. Their portrayal of 1960s housewives was very effective. Overall, visually, this movie does a great job of putting the viewer into the 1960s. Not sure how effective this would be for someone who did not experience the 1960s. Highly recommended.

If you have been in love---and I mean that special love that only happens once---then you will love this movie about first love. I couldn't turn it off and knew it was something different from the start. Two so destined for love yet one is the only willing one at first. You long for the boy to realize that is one very special girl that he will never forget yet he just doesn't get it until the last. Well, isn't that the way life is so often. Yet in the end all works out. Not a Rob Reiner fan but he he masterfully told a story that I shall not forget.

As it goes, this movie is unique in its own league. Everyone wouldn't be able to get the emotional and teenage baggage carried by characters in this film. For the first time in my life I am reviewing a movie all because I found It worthy. This movie is no for fairy tale believers but for people who love and enjoys practical love, real life crush stories. This movie is truly one in a million and Juli baker won heart of viewers.
I love everything about this movie, the plot, actors, storyline and young love.

I didn't know anything about this book or movie when it appeared at my local cineplex, but some quick research showed me there were some quality people associated with it -- Aiden Quinn, John Mahoney, Anthony Edwards and, most especially, Rob Reiner. Reiner has made some of my favorite movies of all time and shown, perhaps, more diversity than any other director working today (could you get more different than This is Spinal Tap, Stand by Me, The Princess Bride, A Few Good Men, and When Harry Met Sally?). At his best, his films are a home run, and even his worst films were solid base hits, but I guess everyone has to strike out once in a while.As I watched this story unfold in a very straight forward, obvious and uninteresting way, I struck by the uniformly poor acting from everyone (with the possible exception of Mahoney). Then it dawned on me -- it's not the acting, it's the characters. Each was a simple stereotype and barely even 2 dimensional. The actors were doing exactly what was being asked of them and the only fault I can really find with them is their poor choice in choosing this project in the first place. And the worst part of it is that the story itself was not that bad. It was just poorly executed.I have not given up on Rob Reiner as filmmaker. He has given me hundreds of hours of enjoyment over the years. So I'm just going to try to put this clunker he phoned in out of my mind and will go back and watch The American President for the 20th time.

As a big fan of the book, this movie was a major let down to me. I know movies can't include every detail of a book, but some scenes were changed in a way that removed all the emotion the book created. (When Chet told Bryce why his mother was crying and whenever he spoke to him it wasn't as if they never spoke.) When Bryce told him family about the chickens, instead of telling them he didn't actually ask Juli, he simply lied and let them think he did. The fact that the actual story doesn't take place in the late 1950s also makes it completely different. I disliked how Bryce only had lunch with one girl on the day of the auctions. I did not finish watching the movie, but as a person who enjoyed every word of the book, this movie was a major let down.Pros - Juli and Bryce narrating their sides of each story, good technologyCons - strayed away from book too much, Bryce's mom and sister looked too alike (I got them confused and I disliked his mother's hair), being set in a different time (I would understand '90s but '60s is too much).

Rob Reiner delivers another nostalgia fest of a film, a movie that seemingly has no qualms with sickingly saccharine moments of youthful innocence. Does Flipped compare to other similar Reiner films, like Stand By Me? No. But what Flipped does, it does well. The acting is genuine, and manages to capture a semblance of the timeless facets of youth that seem unburdened by time. Although the film can err on playing out like something out of a 50's TV series, Reiner manages to blend the cutesy kitsch with touching moments that keep this film from turning into a sugary mess. One could argue the film is slow and uneventful, and to a certain extant I agree. Despite this, Flipped manages to intrigue and make you feel all fuzzy inside. 8/10. Great movie!

I get that a lot of people don't like watching cheesy films because it is well cheesy and unrealistic.And I guess it is also a cliche when I say that Flipped is so much more than that.But it is.You have both the perspectives which gives us an understanding how they will always be two sides to a coin. The movie flipped is a romantic comedy-drama film about two teenagers, Bryce Loski and Juli Baker played by Callan McAuliffe and Madeline Carroll. Although the actors did a pretty good job the plot was slow and boring.The decor seems a bit like the early 70s or the late 60s but in reality the movie takes place in 1953. I also feel like the way that the people in the movie where talking to modern compared to when the movie takes place, I can excuse this since the movie is made for kids or young teenagers so it would be kind of hard for them to understand if the people spoke in old english. If you are a kid that doesn't really care about details and likes romance then you could maybe like the movie.There was a scene I really didn't like when Juli and her father visit her mentally disabled uncle. The acting of the uncle was excessive and showcased a small minority of how mentally disabled people act, this could make children watching the movie belive that all mentally disabled act this way. The uncle was also in a special place for mentally disabled people which is realistic for the time at which the movie takes place, but I feel like adults should explain too children that most mentally disabled people don't live in those kinds of places anymore.I think that the movie lacks originality with the girl meets boy plot that has been repeated over a hundred times.I got really annoyed by the poor and unrealistic choices of the teenagers during the movie.Overall I am really unimpressed by the movie and I would not recommend for anyone who doesn't like slow movies. The only thing I was impressed with was the actors.

When you meet that person, you suddenly understand that life can be beautiful like this.The grandfather in the film said: Some people are shallow, and some people are superficial. One day you will meet a rainbow of gorgeous people. When you meet this person, you will feel that other people are just floating clouds.Bryce's grandfather says about Juli, "Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss.... But every once in a while you find someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare."
I am very happy that there are still such beautiful poetic feelings in human nature. Let's light up each other's lives and make this increasingly dim world seem so warm and beautiful from time to time.Let us light a small lamp in our heart when our face is aging and we lose the ability to dream, and let the poetry spread out from the bottom of our heart, turning into an old smile on the corner of our mouth.

I have heard a saying: I have always believed that there are some love in this world that cannot be avoided and replaced like fate.The soul is given by the color, and it needs to be matched with life. When you meet that person, you suddenly realize that life can be beautiful like this.In the movie, my grandfather said, "Some people are shallow, and some people are just as superficial as others.". One day you will meet a rainbow like gorgeous person, and when you meet this person, you will feel that everyone else is just a floating cloud.Bryce's grandfather says about Juli, "Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss.... But every once in a while you find someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare."
"flipped" is a very simple story, but it is very rich. The main story is about children's puppy love. In fact, this movie also tells about pursuing their dreams, respecting, industrious, how to treat poverty, how to accept disabled families, and how to maintain their self-esteem.One detail that impressed me deeply is that after the parents quarreled, they immediately said to the child, "We will solve it, it's not your fault." Then they took turns comforting her, indicating that the parents still love each other and reassuring the child. That's why children feel, "I don't think it's easy for Mom, and I don't think it's easy for Dad, either. But born in this family, I'm lucky." Loving parents are better than wealthy parents.Continue with "flipped". I envy this kind of heroine in American culture, just like the old lady in "UP": she has an adventurous spirit, a romantic spirit, a courage to be different, a sense of wisdom and responsibility, a down-to-earth ability to achieve her dreams, a vibrant, loving, loved, healthy body and soul. In our popular culture, the female protagonists are mostly foolish and naive, confused, optimistic, and emotionally rich, waiting for the male protagonist to take pity on them.In a nutshell, the heroine in the United States is a tree, a flowering tree that grows well without a hero;
Our heroine is a flower, a crippled flower, some with tragic experiences and bodies, waiting for a man to save them. Bad love is when you lose the whole world for one person
Good love is when you see the whole world through one personI always want to strive to enrich myself and make myself better than before. I want to be a person with a gorgeous heart in my grandfather's mouth. So that I can meet you with a strong and beautiful
Beautiful Shirley only talks about tents and food. And Julie, who is not very attractive, can join the conversation of "perpetual motion machine" at will .This is not to say that face is not important to girls .The same sentence should be used to attract others with the appearance of beauty to discover your inner beautyRather than seeing your emptiness and ignorance as people get closer to you.A girl like Julie is really cute with a kind heart that understands beauty and life. Climb a tall tree and watch the sunrise and sunset. Think about the whole that is larger than the part. She said to Bryce that there's no room for beautiful things in your eyes. I sympathize with you. The infinite beauty of the setting sun seen on the wutong tree
The little wisdom and subtle details embodied throughout the film also add color to itWho would have thought that a boy's secular, rude, and mean father had a musical dream when he was a teenager
Life is like a ruthless knife that has changed our appearanceGrandfather exists as a bridge to guide boys to communicateI like his white hair and sideburns, showing a wise and uncommon temperament
What an extraordinary woman is that grandmother who is always mentioned by him
A kind girl mother who supports a poor family with loveAlways have a warm expectation for a better lifeThe alternation of psychological activities between boys and girls is also ingeniousThe pounding heart is enough to tell this sweet story of adolescence.

The other characters are vividly described, and the story is interwoven and The story is gripping, compelling and strong, but the father character is a little too extreme.between the surface and internal of beauty. Bryce start bit by bit form a cowardly kid learned to listen to his inner voice, learned to brave. At last, I like the words of Bryce's Grandfather said about Julie, "Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss.... But every once in a while you find someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare."I like this movie very much and hope to see more similar movies.

1. Quick transition of plot and make me feel a little uncomfortable. The transition from boys hating girls to liking each other was too fast for me to accept.2.the ending is too sloppy to accept..but the Flip is a true love movie. A film about pure love in youth. That feeling is very sincere, and it is also very desirable. One is just beginning to love someone, another is not experienced in worldly affairs, and even there is a light hidden in his eyes.One person's emotions are understood by another person with reason, and such an understanding must not lead to a correct solution. From then on, there is a party who pays. The one who is loved is high and fearless, and the person who is most vulnerable to injury is the one who pays first. Only when two people are happy, all your efforts will be worthwhile."First love" is always a topic worth remembering by people all over the world, and it will never fade. When you think of it many years later, I wish you would still miss that bitter memory. Therefore, it is better to lack than abuse, and find the right person.

This "heartache" is not love at first sight, just a moment of heart resonance, the tremor of the soul. The movie ends with a pair of tightly held hands, next to a young sycamore tree. The afterglow of the sunset wrapped in two people, everything looks so happy. Such a ending, suspense is full, gave sufficient space for association, let us doubt, and bless this good match.

Personally, the plots of the movie fit in my tasty. The film is great. But the end of the movie is different from my ideas. It is amazing. The girl Juli is so kind and naive that she accepted the apology of Bryce so easily. Maybe she is a pure love warrior. She is dipping in the love of Bryce. Besides, I don't like the father of Bryce. He is selfish. He is good at denying others. He is unable to do something, and he is willing to listen the failure of others denying others. Furthermore, I admire the grandfather of Bryce. Flipped adopt a cross narrative approach from both male and female perspectives was still novel and unique at the time. Two families shape different personalities of male and female leaders. Juli's character is passion and generous. She stays clear about emotions. Bryce is Irrational in somewhere,though he lately konw his feelings for girls. Though the boy finally planted a tree for the girl, there are factors such as family that can affect their relationship. I think this love can't last long. When there is a conflict, they will review what the male master has done before. The final result was a breakup.

The fliming style is perfect and I like the hazy atmosphere of the frames. But Juli's thought full of romance and unrealistic.The girl are growing up, while boys are always thinking about focusing on his own problems. They couldn't think on the same level.Bryce's father is subject to changing moods,and Regardless of other people's feelings. So that affected his children-Bryce,that always do what he thinks right,ok,it's fine,but hurt Juli,because the lack of communication.However Bryce actually didn't force himself to break the wall,his family talks around the corner. He can't jump out of the cycle unless he really to be empathetic like the hostess and endure all kinds of injustice instead of complaining about why and why first.Let's look at the heroine. Juli was fulling love thus what she said the dazzling eyes,and after several years she keep her enthusiasm to Bryce until the sycamore tree was cut down.She has her own mentalworld,with peeking sunshine,the meadow,her father's painting time...All of them is beauty,bright and straight. She also changed her mind to think whether Bryce worth her love,whether she need to continue this relationship.She did yes,but I want to say no.I'm sorry to break this romance. But I don't know that two families with different views will have a good result together, which is unfair to Juli. She have empathy and compassion,but Bryce don't have as much as her.At the end,I wanna say:If you like never-ending love,this movie is still suitable for you.

Maybe my expectation for the movie was too high, and I was not satisfied with the ending after watching it. Julie is an independent and thoughtful girl. She is determined, confident, she deserves a better man instead of Bryce--a jerk, a coward. Compared with Julie, what Bryce has done is more ignorant and shallow. From another point of view, Bryce's family atmosphere is not good, his father looks down on Julie's family and even everything about Julie. A father's influence on his children is huge, I think in this kind of education, Bryce is not a good match for Julie. The logic of this movie is not sound. I think the reason that Julie falls in love with Bryce is too far-fetched. A pair of sparkling eyes is not worthy of her love again and again.

In my opinion,I prefer happy ending. But in the movie,the hero too little done,he always numb for himself feeling and only plant a tree with the heroine. In many times,he made the girl sad. I like the feeling of beckoning about the girl,but the boy shoud be better to match the love. In the life,everyone can persuit oneself love,but I don't have this brave. In the movie,I like the girl's brave and insist and hate the boy's coward. In my life,if have a boy like this,maybe I could be feel happy about this beckoning,but after knewn more about him and know his charater is like this I will loss my feeling at begaining.

I think the movie is very good. Both Juli and Chet touched me deeply. I have watched it once before, and I still like juli very much after watching it again. Juli's courage to pursue what she likes is very admirable to me. She made her liking plain and works for it. Bryce's performance, by contrast, is not something I like very much. Juli thought he is a coward and I think so. He was afraid to speak his mind directly and didn't know how to say no. And because of that, he hurt Juli. I think the end is not ok. Juli deserves better than him. And I think he need to apologize to Juli Baker earnestly. Anyway, I still love this movie, you know. And I hope you'll enjoy it, too.

Flipped is one of my favorite movies. It describes a very beautiful crush and puppy love,which reminds me of my girlhood. I prefer Juli than Bryce because she is such a thoughtful girl. Also she is emotional. But it is acceptable because she is still so young.I love the lines which was very famous: Some of us get in flat ,some in satin ,some in gloss ;but every once in a while,you find someone who's iridescent, and once you do, nothing will ever compare.I was very impressed by this line. It touched me deeply.I can't agree with this more because I've met people like this myself. All in all the movie is well worth seeing.

The film is about the young love exploration process of two young children. After the little girl fell in love with the little boy at first sight, she began to pursue the initiative. In this process, the girl's understanding of the boy and love gradually changed from appearance to a combination of internal and external parts. At the same time, the film also shows the love between the family, and shows the infinite tolerance and love between the girl's father and her uncle, which also enables the heroine to find and maintain these sources of love in the pursuit of love. Finally, the hero faces the girl's love and reminds us to respond to others' love for you.

I feel the sweet love between the two so cute children after watching this movie.Juli Baker is a brave and frank girl,she is so cool that I admire her very much. She's brave enough to pursue her love and bold enough to express it. Although it can be a little overwhelming and embarrassing at times,her pure and genuine love is impressive and worthy of praise.I love the part where Julie's dad talks to her while he's painting. A painting is more than the sum of its parts. People are the same, sometimes only look at the part will think he is very good,but look at the overall will be very small. I think this is a truth of life.

I think the plot of the first is unreasonable,the girl fell in love with boy just because his dazzling eyes and she didn't sad about the attitude of the boy's father. When she needs help especially, the boy doesn't stand beside her, and often finds various excuses to deceive him. If it were me, I would have been disappointed. In the following story, the boy lost the girl's hard-earned eggs and echoed others to speak ill of her, which has proved that the boy is a coward.Of curse,The actions and practices of Bryce's grandfather and Julie's father have left us a lot of life lessons and worth to learn.

Today my English teacher let us watch this movie Flipped. He has the self-esteem of a teenager, but this self-esteem can sometimes be really hurtful. In fact, from the perspective of youth, I can understand Bryce, but I cherish the kindness from others more. Only people are different. In the final outcome, it was fortunate that Bryce explained to Julie and made compensation, otherwise I would have hated Bryce very much.

You know,Bryce--one's character is set at an early age. I'd hate to see you swimout so far you can't 'swim back. It's about honesty,son. For me,it was the beginning of what would be more than half a decade of strategic avoidance and social discomfort.8. The next thing I know,he's holding my hand and looking right into my eyes. Myheart stopped. Was this it? Would this be my first kiss?

It's about 8 or so years in the lives of two kids who meet when when one of them moves into a new neighborhood. Juli (played by Morgan Lily and Madeline Carroll) is instantly smitten by Bryce (Ryan Ketzner and Callan McAuliffe) the second she sees him drive up to his new house. Bryce, being a typical second grade boy, finds her attention embarrassing and unwanted. As they get older, that dynamic between them remains pretty much the same, but we wouldn't have a very interesting movie if that's all there was to it. Eventually Bryce finds himself on the other side of the equation (flipped, get it?), and has to win back the girl he never knew he always wanted.The movie is shown from the POV's of both main characters, and often the same event will be shown from each of their perspectives. It works really well. I heartily recommend this to anyone who likes a good, well-written movie, regardless of the genre. You can tell that a lot of heart went into making Flipped, and it shows. Great movie.

Flipped is easily the best love story movie I've ever seen. Juli just looked into Bryce's blue eyes and decided to give him her first kiss. This is the purest feeling of a little girl. Bryce, however, was ungrateful. Even though Juli is such a nice and kind girl, Bryce still hates her. But things are getting better. Bryce gradually saw the good qualities in Julie and decided to make up for her after hurting her. Julie, who is kind, and Bryce, who can correct her mistakes, are not perfect roles. But it is these imperfections that make the characters in the film vivid.In a word, I was moved by their pure and beautiful feelings.

Flipped is a meaningful movie. In the pure love of young men and girls, there are many philosophies of life.Movie narrates from two perspectives,explained the emotional changes of the male and femaprotagonists. The director's transition was smooth and the little actors' performance was also very good.The love between two teenagers is so romantic. In the process of the story,we can experience their beautiful puppy love. We can also see the life philosophy."The whole being greater than the sum of its parts",Juli's view of Bryce's father,The different family environments between Juli and Bryce. There are many details waiting for us to explore.In general,I would like to recommend this story under the sycamore tree to everyone.

"Flipped" contains many elements. And these elements can greatly arouse the empathy of the audience. In the film,my favorite word is "the higher I got,the more amazed I was by the view"Juli said. We can easily feel the unique significance of the sycamore tree to her. But in Bryce's view,it's just a normal tree. Misunderstanding in the story and the change of roles,The film devolps from two different perspectives, simple but deep. The overall atmosphere of the film is changeable. Different kye events bring us diverse feelings. Those events make the role real,we can remember many character in the movie and feel their emotion,wise grandfather,mean father (Bryce's),and gentle father (Juli's).All in all,this film is worth watching no matter what age you are.

The story is about a girl who crushed on a boy. The movie showed from two different views, so we can know exactly the boy is annoyed by all the attention he gets from the girl. But as he gets to know her more, his feelings are changed. In this process you can see the influence of family on children, and the maturity of childish emotions.The main two characters, Juli and Bryce, are very likable and believable in their roles, which they play excellently. The other characters are also extremely good in details. The characters felt like real people, and the issues faced in the story felt so real and believable, it made me believe in the basic form of love once more, and that it still existed in real life.The director Rob Reiner is talented in romances. He helps us to understand the beautiful things of the human beings: love, kindness,respect,forgiveness and honor. Maybe someone would say that the girl's love is so cheap and unreasonable but I call it truly love. The first love is just that kind of thing: silly,rash,about nothing.Also, the music and scenes in the movie are beautiful. They create a romantic atmosphere which is absolutely amazing and expressive. Everyone who has a first love will identify with those cute characters and the realistic plot.

Flipped is a total gem, it is a welcome breath of fresh air. This is the most novel love movie I have seen recently.It's about two young children's love-hate entanglement,it will make you emotional disturbance,there ara several outright bittersweet or poignant scenes within the story. Some pictures are beautiful,such as when Juli sit on the buttonwood and watch the sunrise and sunset,the scenery is great. And some times will silence you,such as when Juli's father get angry and hit Juli'sister.I can't describe with words how I feel,but I'm sure you will shine at the moment,you must have to see it!

The main two characters,Juli and Bryce,are very likeable. The movie is unfolded through rhe two characters,making people surprised.In the meantime,I really like how the story shows. The overall painting style of the film is very fresh and beautiful,and it is easy to immerse people in it. Bryce gradually approached and fell in love with Julie from the beginning through resistance. This process is also a signal of his own inner transformation.Although the plot of the movie is a bit old-fashioned, it still tells the people a lot of truth. For example, it is necessary to look at a person with heart, communicate promptly when encountering difficulties, and not discriminate against vulnerable groups.

After watching this movie , my heart was like empty. Without the adults' overthinking,the kids' love are far purer which is the most touched point in the movie. The light and shadow, music and pictures of movies is gentle .In the meanwhile, The rhythm of the movie is slow that made me feel relaxed. In particular, the film narrates from two perspectives, which enriches the structure of the film. On rainy days, listen to the rain and watch this movie with your lover would be a romantic thing. Anyway, I also learned a lot of things in this movie. Like we need be brave and follow your heart to face your flipped with someone.

Love at first sight or love over time, Julie in this movie makes me feel a little empathy. Originally, she was lively and cheerful, and lived freely. Until she met him, Bryce, she began to care about his opinions and became sensitive. After experiencing a lot, Julie began to get preoccupied. She no longer had the smile of the past. This can't help but make me feel, "Love yourself first", don't let others control your emotions."Love rises with the wind, and it's hard to calm down."Fortunately, the ending of the story developed into what most people would like to,this movie ends up with a happy ending.

In this movie,it is very interesting to see two viewpoints on this everyday happening. In this way,viewers can effectively get the true nature of their friendship,love and respect of they have for each other. For me,it is unhesitatingly surprising. At first, Juli constantly loves Bryce ,and then when Juli's attitude changes,Bryce starts to notice and fall in love with her. How interesting!In the plot,humor,forgiveness,family conflict and the lost idealism of youth are told by actors' performances. There are several outright bittersweet scenes,also.Juli Baker,is a smart,adventurous and thoughtful girl who you just cat not imagine how she is pretty about her personality. Her independent character makes herself better.It is really worth watching.

I think the movie is refreshing and lovely, dramatic and hilarious. For most of us,the story of first love is an old topic in the movie , we've all heard it before. However, Flipped gave me a sense of refreshing because in my view,this movie is enjoyable and among a few to which we relate to. When I saw the movie, I could put myself into it,feeling characters' feelings. They are so real and believable for me. Meanwhile the unusual about the story telling is that each major event is played back twice - once through the eyes and voice of Bryce and once through the eyes and voice of Juli. It's the same scene, but you wouldn't know that from their differing viewpoints. I think the multi-perspective narrative approach helps us better understand the inner changes and emotional fluctuations of the protagonists.

You have to admit it.it's just a classic first love story without any surprise.but honestly speaking,it's also a good story.A crush love for the first sight.some little but impressive mistakes.It seems that you can find something alike in your own life for every single thing in the story .A good friend,a tall tree with many memories, a mean neighbor,a stupid school activity,and the most important thing,a good girl.It takes everyone to there teenager times,it reminds you of your first love,it makes you laugh and feel emo after you realized that you no longer seen that one many years ago.It worth a look.

I only have 4 favorite movies, Cast Away, 50 First Dates, One More Chance and Flipped..And among all these, only Flipped made me wanted to watch it over and over, getting the same nostalgic and satisfying feeling every time..I believe that only really good movies can make you feel that way..I loved how I understood each of the leading roles' point of view in same scenes which are played twice..I enjoyed the detailed phasing of this movie that even the minor roles were as essential as the leading ones.Moreover, the setting of this movie suits perfectly in its genre which is old-school teenage romance.I realized how charming and beautiful first love could be especially when started at early age,,This movie finally gave justice to how my first love drama turned out.. I always recommend this movie every time I'm asked about what good movies to watch!

"All I ever wanted was for Juli Backer to leave me alone." Maybe for many boys, when they are young, they don't know how to love and nobody tells them what to do to understand their inherent emotions to the girl. And most of them are impatient and annoyed . They dislike whatever the girl to do and try to do many things bad to make the girl upset. But the boy dosen't know he pays more attention to the gril inadvertently and the girl has stated in a special position in his heart.However, what he did actually hurt the gril which let she decided to abandon every thought of him. When he realized this, he was also sad and might try to win back the gril. In the end, someone will fall in love again, but comeone not,because something missed can't come back. Immature love is bittersweet, but the first love is always pure and clean. Growth teachs us how to love and cherish the one worthy.

The film tells of the love between the two children, rarely mixed with social factors, more pure like and cleaner romantic color. In the film, in the order of time, through the repeated changes in the perspective of the two protagonists, reflecting the rich emotional process between them, but also highlights the respective personality image of the male and female masters, as well as more delicate psychological changes, people are not tired of watching. The tall sycamore tree was cut down to make us realize the pure state of mind of the female master, the endless yearning for nature, the egg event made the feelings of the two ferment again make the male master feel guilty again, for the turning point of the love line, and finally the hostess accidentally heard the male master laughing at her uncle and her classmates for her complete disappointment and determination to the male master. This layer of events advance, so that the emotional changes of the two people ups and downs in the context of reason. At the end of the film, the boy planted a sycamore tree in the girl's yard. The female master was very moved and forgave him. This paragraph echoed with the beginning, as if to draw a perfect end to the whole story line. The audience's heart must also be very happy. In such an era of rapid development and fast-food love, their heartbeat is worth cherishing. Itself is clean and pure, do not blind their eyes in front of utilitarian fame and fortune, to hug it, hug the pure love that belongs to you.

After a few years, I watched this movie again. The way this story telling still astonished me. The events are played back twice by Juli's eyes and Bryce's eyes. The comparison of Juli's and Bryce's view is so fascinating, isn't it?Each time I watch this film,I can't help smiling --I can't refuse such pure affection! The love in real life is often mixed with impurities, which makes pure love more precious. I believe in love in this moment.Nonetheless,I'm not optimistic about the future of this relationship. In my view, the misunderstanding between this two families has not been fully resolved. There are also some challenges like this lie in the way. They need more run-in to go further.

When I firstly watch this movie,I fall in love with the beautiful picture of this film. The color,composition of a picture make me feel confortable. And I see the classical construction and family atmosphere in American which are so different from where I live.The film adopts two viewpoints to narrate this this story. I can put myself into the roles'place. To be honest,my favorate role is Juli Baker who is so brave,smart and determined. She is brave to persue everything which she devotes the sincere love into. For Bryce,I witness his growth. In this film I see what is the real friendship. At least,truly friend shouldn't do what. What's more,I learn that he whole is less than the sum of its parts. We should learn to be the one that the whole more than the addition of parts.

"The one you love doesn't love you back, and you don't love the one that loves you!"The film encourages the viewers to embrace their unique experiences and the people in their lives, as they shape who we are and who we became.I feel that this is not a movie about love and first love, but how people should treat themselves and others who seem to be incompatible with their surroundings, how to face the embarrassment and difficulties in life, and learn and grow.Overall, flipped is a delightful movie. It's a reminder that even the most mundane moments in life can hold the greatest significants.

I have completely fallen in love with this film. The puppy love between Julia and Bryce. After watching the movie. I think of a poem like these--Some of us get dipped in flat,some in satin,some gloss.... But every once in a while you find someone who's iridescent,and when you do,nothing will ever compare. A pair of children, a tree,a desirable love story. Julia is one of the few figures I vividly remember from that time.she is smart and enthusiastic. Finally,I think that's not only about love and first love. .but also tell us how to treat ourselves and others how to face the difficulties ,and learn and grow.

"Flipped" seems to be a story about the ignorant love between a young man and a young girl, but in fact, it is more about showing the best aspects of human nature to the audience. We can see that there are also many contradictions and disputes in the film, but this does not prevent the director from deliberately extending warm love throughout the entire film. On the contrary, these contradictions and disputes make the theme of the film more profound. I believe that no matter in which century, love is an eternal theme. We flip form Juli point of view to Bryce point of view,very effectively giving us the ture nature of their friendship.

This is the most beautiful film I have ever seen in my youth. "Flipped" begins with a giant, lush sycamore tree and ends with another one they planted. They are like a pair of happy enemies, in pursuit, in roughhouse, there is joy, throbbing, there also is sad. In our Chinese words," they are innocent playmates". The characters in the movie are portrayed vividly by the actors, such as Juli Baker who is bold , smart and dares to love and hate, Bryce who is handsome and a little timid, and Grandpa who is kind and so on. Compared with Under the Hawthorn Tree, I think it is a film with the most novel perspective, the most intelligent characters and the purest emotions I have ever seen. Now I have 21 years old, still will be for such a pure and beautiful love.

The plot of this movie is interesting, the language is lively, and the emotion is boring. The tall and lush sycamore tree runs through Julie and Bryce's feelings for each other from escape to face from beginning to end. At the same time, it also represents a spiritual height, with a comprehensive examination of the natural scenery and the whole life. Julie likes to climb to this tree and look at the gorgeous glow in the sky. Sometimes the sunset glows purple, and sometimes the orange fire ignites the sunset in the sky. Seeing this scene, I was always intoxicated by such a natural beauty. Julie also regarded this tree as her spiritual home. She rested on the sycamore tree, and also thought about the meaning of her father's "the whole is greater than the sum of parts" on the sycamore tree, and formed a correct outlook on life on the sycamore.

The film is warm and healing, starting from a girl's uncrush on a neighbor boy. The hero was afraid and disgusted of the heroine at first, but after his grandfather reminded him, he began to be attracted by the girl's light. Like a person, perhaps just to see his bright eyes, and then heartache, but the most important is to accept his shortcomings. The romantic ending of the movie is also everyone's yearning for love. So when you meet someone you be brave. Maybe there will be unexpected surprises,you will meet. One day, we will meet someone who will be unique in your eyes. Put down your pride and go for love.

We are always shy in our youth. For this reason,Bryce Lsoski was usd to run away from Juli Bakerk's passions. It hurt the little girl who loved her ,Especially when the eggs she had prepared were thrown away in the trash. But then I thought it was youth. That's what struck me about this movie. When you love someone ,your eyelashes will jump up and down, and small stars will jump out of it. Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss. But every once in a while youfind someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare. If you don't notice,they will eventually leave you.

Flipped is a romantic film with a novel theme. It's about 8 or so years in the lives of two kids who meet when one of them moves into a new neighborhood. Juli fell for him at first sight and she goes crazy for him Bryce. Bryce, being a typical second grade boy, finds her attention embarrassing and unwanted. Don't even like her, he is impatient with her. As they get older, after an egg storm, a lunch date, and so on, he found himself liking her. But Juli was very disappointed in Bryce,decided to abandon every thought of Bryce. Bryce makes a last attempt to win Juli's heart by planting a sycamore tree in her backyard. At last Juli decides to give him a second channce.

Flipped seems to tell the ignorant love story between a pair of young boys and girls. In fact, it shows the best side of human nature more in front of the audience. We can see that there are many contradictions and disputes in the film, but this does not prevent the director from carrying warm love throughout the film. On the contrary, these contradictions and. Disputes in the film, but this does not prevent the director from carrying warm love throughout the film. On the contrary, these contradictions and disputes make the theme of the film more profound. I think that no matter in which century, love is an eternal theme. The love mentioned in the film is not only the love of the hero and heroine we see. The scope of this love is very large. The heartbeat is not only people, but also a taste and a feeling.

The two fell in love with each other at different times, with misuanderstandings and disputes,
and finally exhanged their thoughts and get a happy ending. In short, it is a warm and loving story with little twists and turns.I also learned from it that love is not smooth sailing, and we will go through the stage of growing up together. We're all imperfect. But for each other, we keep introspecting and giving. It is difficult to maintain the feelings given by only one party, and the mutual understanding of both parties is very important. We grow in love and are happy, which means we have a healthy and happy relationship.

Juli Baker,she is full of human sparkles, and in her childhood, she appeared to be more mature than her peers. In dealing with emotions, she coexists with sensibility and rationality. She has the courage to face up to her love and has always been firm in her choice, courageously pursuing the boy she likes through proper means. What's more valuable is that this kind of love is not blindly worshipping, but constantly examining her emotions, reflecting on what kind of talent she truly wants and what kind of emotions are worth sticking to. In dealing with life, she places equal emphasis on enjoyment and reflection. She will cry for the lost wutong tree, and also rejoice for the new life coming out of the shell. She knows how to observe, is diligent in thinking, and is good at finding perfection in life from different perspectives, and understands the true meaning of "the whole is greater than the sum of parts".In addition, the director's use of close range, mid range, and long range in the film is very standardized and impeccable. However, in this film, which depicts the hazy and beautiful love between adolescent boys and girls, the most attractive thing is that in the golden setting sun, both the female and male masters are covered in the warm sunlight, glittering, casting a layer of soft light on their emotions, not only reducing the vitality of young people, but also highlighting the beautiful emotions between young people, causing the audience to resonate and leave a deep impression.

Flipped is a good movie about first love and pure love. The picture is very fresh and beautiful .The story of the boy and the girl is full of interest,drama and moving,especially the discussion about the family conflict.In this story,Tulip Baker fall in love with Bryce Loski,but Bryce is annoyed by her constant and persistent attention. And after some ups and downs,they ends up together. In elementary school,Juli becomes crazy about saving her favorite sycamore tree from being cut down. And Juli gives Bryce eggs,but Bryce's family think the eggs contain salmonella ,so Bryce ends up throwing the eggs away. And some dramatic things has happened.All in all,if you like watching some little fresh movie,then it's a good choice.

"Flipped" is superly directed by Rob Reiner,and in my book.one of his best movies. I really liked a sentence that is "The one you love does not love you back,and you do not love the one that loves you!"The life always like this. Despite the main story is not that all can relate to,the story was really nice. And the characters acting was really good and wonderful. This movie was one of the most beautiful movies that i have seen wonderful in every sense of the word. I really like this moive. Truly,this is one of those rare gemes you stumble upon only once in a blue moon. Give it a try! You will like it !

When Bryce was a child , he and his family moved to the opposite of Juli Baker's house. The first day Juli Baker met Bryce Loski , she flipped. For him, it was the beginning of what would be more than half a decade of strategic avoidance and social discomfort. In the sixth grade, he took action. He made friend with Sherry Stalls to get Juli Baker off their back. Soon later his supposed best friend Garrett Einbinder, loyalty gave way to desire, told Sherry what Bryce was up to. For Juli, it was clear Bryce had feelings for her, but Bryce was just too shy to show them. This is not only a childhood romance film, which tells the entire story from different perspectives of boys and girls. "Flipped" is a romance-themed film. Drive the plot by describing the love story between Juli and Bryce. Juli passed from love to hate to love. The plot is turbulent and fascinating. After reading it, I was also deeply touched by this girl. She is independent and hardworking, self-respecting but not sensitive enough to have thorns all over her body. The first moment Julie locked eyes with Bryce, she couldn't stop thinking about the first kiss that could have happened between them, the first kiss that this wonderful boy treasured. Everything went on in this inexplicable way -- Julie was constantly expressing her affection for Bryce and pursuing him. Bryce hated Julie, but had to be a gentleman while doing everything he could to keep her away. After all, in the eyes of his family and his family, the person named Julie not only looks ordinary, but also does not have the right "lawn" for him. Everything has come to a ridiculous pace.Julie's father, a painter, told her that looking at a person is like looking at a painting, you can't just look at some simple part of it, and a painting is more than the sum of its parts.Look at the whole picture. It's dangerous to look at the parts, to look at the whole, to seek the beauty of the whole being greater than the sum of its parts. Julie didn't quite understand what her father had said. She just enjoyed climbing up to a sycamore tree in the school bus waiting area for a view. Up there, you get a different view.Until one day, she had to climb up high in the plane tree to pick up the kite, that day, she was fascinated by the scenery. Julie began to think about what her father had said, and she began to notice people she met at school. She found that the sum of the parts was always greater than the whole in almost all people, except for Bryce. She could not read him, she thought. Julie finally realized that Bryce was a coward at heart, with gorgeous looks, bright eyes, and a charming smile. She knew that all along it was just her not wanting to "see" -- that the whole of Bryce was less than the sum of its parts. She was relieved. And Bryce, who was left out in the cold
Under Grandpa's influence, I realized Julie's kindness more and more. He could not understand how he could not want to be close to such a girl. He summoned up his courage to get rid of his cowardice, no longer for the flashy rules of etiquette and against the heart, even in the case of friends threatened to break up with him, Bryce still boldly went to Julie's front, to show his heart. After Bryce planted a new sycamore tree for her, he touched Julie, who had been ignoring him, and they reconciled."She adds to the beauty of the world you see through her own presence, and her experiences enhance your experience of the beauty of the world you see through your own."

"Flipped" is a coming-of-age romantic comedy-drama film directed by Rob Reiner. It follows the story of Juli and Bryce, two classmates who have known each other since second grade. Juli has always been enamored with Bryce, but he sees her as just a friend. As they grow up, their feelings toward each other begin to change, causing them to question what they mean to each other.The film is based on the novel of the same name by Wendelin Van Draanen and features an ensemble cast including Madeline Carroll, Callan McAuliffe, Rebecca De Mornay, Anthony Edwards, John Mahoney, and Aidan Quinn. The film received positive reviews for its performances, direction, and nostalgic tone.

Julie's love for Bryce begins with his beautiful blue eyes. The change in his attitude comes from doubts about his character. We all find a pair of beautiful eyes and like beautiful and exquisite things, but for a person's love at first sight may come from natural attraction, just like Julie and Blake, Julie is seeing him. She determined the future at a glance. She was tireless. She ignored Blake's disbelief, because she was sure that she liked it and wanted to melt Blake's "shyness" with her enthusiasm. But for Black, Julie's harassment made him bored and even annoying, but there was a kind of "Julie" He may or may not like her, but he doesn't know either. Until later, Julie found that Blake had lost the eggs she gave her. She felt ridiculous. She questioned Blake and his love. She found that her love for Black came from a shallow appearance and did not know the real him. Blake regretted it after being questioned by Julie. He wanted to explain and apologize, but by this time Julie had put him down, but he found that he had fallen in love with Julie.I think this is the feeling of youth, pulling back and forth. There are rich emotions in the heart but they are hidden. It shows that nothing happens outside. That is the unique self-esteem and expression of young people!I highly recommend watching this movie. This is what youth looks like. It is beautiful and happy. Although there are small waves, it does not affect the final ending.

I hope every time I see a movie, I can have the ultimate feeling and wonderful experience, just like I saw this movie. I like to see each movie as a unique experience.

I have been a fan or Rob Reiner since I was a kid watching All In The Family. There must be dozens of episodes I specifically recall Reiner in. This movie, Flipped, is exactly why I love the movies. A beautiful story told in a beautiful and emotionally memorable way. It was engrossing, well cast, excellently acted and marvelously directed. Reiner, as far as i am concerned hit it out of the park. A tender and anxious telling of early teen love from the perspective of both protagonists, young Julie and young Bryce. They live across from one another in suburbia and over time, redefine both their relationship and themselves in a scenario of self discovery and understanding.

Andy's toys live a reasonable life of fun and peace, their only worries are birthdays and Christmases, when new toys could easily replace those already there.  One such birthday Andy's top toy, Woody the cowboy, finds himself in direct competition with Andy's new Buzz Lightyear doll.  When rivalries boil over Woody tries to hide Buzz down the side of the bed but accidentally pushes him out the window, the other tops expel Woody, and he leaves with no choice but to find Buzz and return him to the house.  But with only two days before Andy moves house, time is of the essence.Given how often the same mix of animation, wit, jokes and kids humour has been used since Toy Story (Ice Age, Monsters Inc, Bugs Life) it is easy to forget how refreshing it was when it first came out.  I have just watched it again and it is dating a little in comparison to more recent twists on the formula.  It seems each one has to be sharper and have more references etc in the background.  However it is still very funny and deserves praise for being the first of a successful formula.The plot is simple but effective and actually has genuine drama and excitement to it.  The main story is fun but the degree of character development is what really shores it up.  The conflict between Buzz and Woody is taken deeper than this and, when confronted by the truth of his status as a toy, Buzz's turmoil is very real as opposed to him being a cartoon character and nothing more.  Despite the two strong leads there is a real depth in the support cast.  They may not actually have that many lines, but they have all the funniest lines.  Most of the `adult' wit comes from the Potato Head, dinosaur, the pig and slinky dog.  They are funny and are very well used.  In fact the majority of this humour and plot will go right over kids heads.Looking back on it, I do feel a cynical edge on it in so much as this film must really have helped sales of the toy companies in the film.
